question: when did fender start making amps in mexico
api_result: Fender began manufacturing some of its amplifiers in Mexico in the 1990s. This move was part of a broader strategy to offer a more cost-effective product line alongside their American-made counterparts. The Mexican-made amps typically cater to the mid-range market, providing a balance between quality and affordability. Fender's decision to produce amps in Mexico allowed them to maintain competitive pricing while still adhering to a high standard of quality control.
